snippet: Japan lodged a protest with China on Tuesday, calling the move an escalation in a standoff over disputed islands.
abstract: Japan says that Chinese military vessel trained radar used to help direct weapons on Japanese naval vessel near disputed islands in the East China Sea, calling move escalation in standoff over islands.

byline.contributor: Gerry Mullany and Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Japan lodged a protest with China on Tuesday, calling the move an escalation in a standoff over disputed islands.

headline.seo: Japan Says China Aimed Weapons-Targeting Radar at Ship
headline.main: Japan Says China Aimed Military Radar at Ship
headline.print_headline: Japan Says China Aimed Weapons-Targeting Radar at Ship Near Islands
